summary: The Southern Carpathians , also called the Transylvanian Alps, are a group of mountain ranges.
full_text: Serbia is landlocked country located in the Balkans  and in the Pannonian Plain . It shares borders with Bosnia-Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Hungary, the Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro, Romania and Albania. It is landlocked, although access to the Adriatic is available through Montenegro, and the Danube River provides shipping access to inland Europe and the Black Sea.
title: Geography of Serbia
